intro: Colutea paulsenii subsp. mesantha, commonly known as the purple false peacock. It is a flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae, characterized by its striking purple-pink flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits. It is native to high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
